intro: Andersonia lanuginosa, commonly known as the woolly Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces striking, colorful flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
